page.title: 09 Motney Hill saltings
page.content: On the western side of the Motney Hill peninsula is a crescent shaped area of low-lying recently deposited land It is a salt marsh or salting. It consists of hardened estuarine mud up to 1m above high water level dissected by numerous winding channels. These channels vary in width and are irrgular in pattern. They are filled with water at high tide and they are floored with very fine soft mud.The higher drier sections of the marsh which have an extensive plant cover are much firmer under foot. Around the margins of the marsh is a quite distinct beach. It is separated from the marsh by a hardened clay "micro cliff" and is composed of courser sandy material than are the tidal deposits within the marsh. This area of saltings is typical of many on the Medway estuary.
